com.ibm.streams.beam.sdk.io

Class Topic.Publish<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.PTransform<PCollection<T>,PDone>
      • com.ibm.streams.beam.sdk.io.Topic.Publish<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The tuple type to be published.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, HasDisplayData
    Enclosing class:
    Topic

    public static class Topic.Publish<T>
extends PTransform<PCollection<T>,PDone>
    A Publish transform publishes a PCollection for other Beam pipelines and IBM Streams applications to subscribe from it.

    The Publish transform discards timestamps and watermarks. If users would like to keep timestamps, they could apply a ParDo transform to the timestamp into custom type T.

    Below is a minimum example to create a Publish transform that publishes long values.

    
 p.apply(Publish.ofType(Long.class).to(topic))

    The parameter of ofType(Class) will be the published data type and must match the input element type wrapped by the WindowedValue. It will also be the published data type. The Publish transform will discard all timestamp and watermark information on the input stream. If the application needs to preserve the timestamp, it could apply a ParDo transform before the Publish transform to enclose the timestamp data into the published data type. The two parameters of Publish are:

    • to(String) specifies the topic to publish to.
    • ofType(Class) or ofType(TypeDescriptor) specifies the published data type. The latter supports nested generic types, such as TypeDescriptor<KV<Long, Long>>. The published data class must be serializable. The application cannot pass a Beam Coder to Publish because there could be non-Beam subscribers.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ofType

        public static <T> Topic.Publish<T> ofType(TypeDescriptor<T> type)
        Creates a Publish instance that publishes data tuples with the specified the TypeDescriptor.
        Parameters:
        type - the TypeDescriptor of the output data type. It supports nested generic types, such as TypeDescriptor<KV<Long, Long>>.

      • to

        public Topic.Publish<T> to(String topic)
        Sets the topic to publish to.
        A topic name:
        • must not be zero length
        • must not contain the null character (␀)
        • must not contain wild card characters number sign (‘#’ #) or the plus sign (‘+’ +)
        The forward slash (‘/’ /) is used to separate each level within a topic tree and provide a hierarchical structure to the topic names. Topic level separators can appear anywhere in a topic name. Adjacent topic level separators indicate a zero length topic level.

        Parameters:
        topic - the topic to publish to.
